Context: Methods: BD was performed in high-fat diet (HFD)-fed FXR knockout (FXRko) and wild-type (WT) animals.

We previously demonstrated that delivery of BAs to the distal intestine using bile diversion (BD) surgery improved high-fat diet (HFD)-induced obesity, insulin resistance, and energy expenditure in wild-type (WT) mice (4).
Mucosal adaptation to enteral nutrients is dependent on the physiologic actions of glucagon-like peptide-2 in mice.
